message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a unique opportunity to get your hands on something truly valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. I think it's a fair price considering its worth to you is $10000. What do you think?

Hello Alice, thank you for your offer. I understand the value of the product to you, but I believe I can only justify paying up to $12000 for it. Considering my valuation and budget, could we possibly come to an agreement closer to this amount?

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob! I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $13500. It's still a great deal considering its value to you is $10000. What do you think?

Thank you for adjusting your offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. Based on my valuation and budget constraints, I am proposing to purchase the product for $12500. This aligns more closely with what I am able to offer at this time.

I understand your revised offer, Bob, and I'm willing to make another adjustment. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $13000. It's getting close to your budget, and I think it's a fair compromise. What do you think?

Thank you for your continued flexibility, Alice. I appreciate your efforts to reach an agreement. Based on my assessment and budget, I would like to propose purchasing the product for $12750. I hope this proposal will be acceptable to you.

I'm getting close to accepting your offer, Bob, but I still need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $13250. It's the last adjustment I can make, and I hope it will be acceptable to you. What do you think?
